Reviews.Title: “Great staff very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Tabitha1977
Reviews.Content: Small family hotel with a friendly and helpful staff current in English. We loved the breakfast (included in the price) featuring local pastries different types of bread,  cereal, milk, yogurt, fresh fruit,cheese ham and salami, coffee, tea. The room was warm and bathroom very clean. The hotel is located a short walking distance from the centre  and 5 minutes from The termini station. We highly recommend it for a short city trip.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Ali123456Yorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the end of March 2012, which was a quiet time in Rome. We had got the SIT bus from Ciampino Airport to Termini station (8 euros return if booked online - which was really easy to do and you just print off your ticket). From the station it was a 5/10 min walk to the hotel, up the street with the market stalls, from the side of the station that the bus drops you off. Easy to find. We only had 1 suitcase and were fairly fit so it was no problem. The hotel was a bit of a strange setup in that there were 3 or 4 different hotels in the same building. The entrance to the Gabriella Hotel was on the first floor. We arrived at midday and were able to leave our suitcase in a locked room behind reception since we were too early to check-in. Then we went to explore and came back at 4pm to check-in. Our room was on the 2nd floor and to get into the corrider where the room was you had to get reception to buzz open the door. Which was fine but would have been easier had the room card key swiped open this door too! The room was small (the bed took up most of it) and the bathroom was fine (although a bit of a tight squeeze to get in the shower cubicle and not much room once you're in there!). Everything was clean though and we had a TV with BBC World Service so had something to listen to in English. Breakfast started at 7am so we got thereabout 7.30am and most mornings were there by ourselves. Only allowed 1 hot drink, otherwise you have to pay extra. It was a coffee machine which also had hot water for tea. Better to get a teapot and 3 presses of the hot water with your teabag than 1 small coffee. Fruit juice was the usual horrid watered down kind that you always get abroad. There was cereal & milk, yogurt, pastries, bread rolls, jam & butter, cakes. It was fine. The room was quite warm so when we got back for the day we tended to leave the windows open until bedtime just to air the room, however the traffic then sounded like it was in your room! The windows were quite soundproof though. There was an air conditioning unit in our room but no controls so you may need to pay extra for it. In summer you would definately need it. All in all it was conveniently located near to Termini station, close to the Metro and buses which were easy to use (1 euro per journey) and there was a Spar supermarket at Termini (close to the SIT bus stop). It wasn't luxury but we got 4 nights hotel with B&B and Ryanair flights for £250 each, so you can't complain. Would I stay there again? Probably would find a hotel an equal distance from Termini but on the other side, so that you are closer to the Colosseum, etc, but only to save my poor feet from all the walking we did. Please wear comfy shoes (I took 2 pairs which are normally comfy and my husband wore trainers and the soles of our feet were still aching - may be better with thick soled walking shoes since the marble floors of the Vatican, the cobbled streets and the uneven surfaces in the Forum, really do make your feet ache.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Frankieman65
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located in a very good position close to the centre but also not far to the main station for sight seeing around Rome.Nice, family-like hotel with pleasant atmosphere and good and helpfull service:the lady at reception was so helpful answering our many questions and recommending restaurants. Our room was clean and spacious and we loved the views onto the street below. The breakfast is good, not very much variety but you can start the day with a good croissant, ham,salami, cheese or cereals. I will recommend it definetely!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Paulinaposh
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel i stayed in Italy.the room was large and clean,a little bit noisy if you live the Windows opened.the staff was great with us,the 2 girls in the morning really attentive and welcoming.the buffet breakfast delicious expecially the Apple pie and brownie both home Made.the location is really good to go around,easy access to train and bus.i Will remember this small hotel as the best part of my trip.thank you all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: TommyRy
Reviews.Content: The  staff and management are excellent: helpful, friendly and always prepared to go out of their way to ensure you are happy. The hotel itself is spotless, modern with sleek clean lines and conveniently located, well located near the main station, in a street  with bars & restaurants - still quiet , perfect amenities. The reception organized us two tickets for city tour in two minutes while I was searching through internet for days. Will come back with pleasure if stay again in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: CynthiaR1965
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect,short walking distance of most places to see in Rome.  The staff were polite and very helpful. The self-service breakfast was good.Family run place within a residential building, so you will feel at home ! The hotel is surrounded by restaurants, pizzerias and groceries.The market in the street is a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Gosiak2
Reviews.Content: We have stayed 3 night at Hotel Gabriella in February. In overall hotel is a good value for money. Location: very close to Termini station, very convenient location for sightseeing, however not walking distance from attractions like Colosseum etc, not many good restaurants or bars around, for those who would like to have some better restaurants and bars around I would recommend Capio di Fiori location. Rooms: Clean, basic rooms, bed quite comfy, size ok for 3 nights stay, hairdryer and tv (remote contractor- 20 euros deposit) Staff- nice and helpful, it was our B’day trip and we were given a small bottle of champagne and some snacks in the room on our arrival which was very kind of them Breakfasts: very basic, some bread rolls, butter, jam, cheese, ham, hot drinks and quite poor juices In regards to breakfast the only things worth to mention is that on Sunday about 9am (breakfast was served until 9.30am) there was nothing to eat, plates were not replaced on the tables, no cups and ladies who were working there were coming a few times but did not bother with refilling food and providing plates and cups, so management should do something about it. It might have happened because lady who was there every day (possibly a manager) was not in on that day. In overall we mainly were at the hotel during the night time, all day we were sightseeing, for the purpose hotel was good, there are lots of similar hotel in area, looks like all buildings/ flats are converted into accommodations as you can find a few hotels in the same building. In overall for a short city break the hotel is good, if you don’t pay too much for it.

Reviews.Title: “The value is good”
Reviews.Author: nsarquis
Reviews.Content: There are 3 or 4 hotels in the same building. Kinda odd. The hotel is old, but clean and the price was good. The location is also good, 4 blocks from Termini Station. Easy to go everywhere. But really annoying is money for everything. To use the wi-fi you have to pay in advance, cash. If you are in the bed, you must get dressed and go downstairs to pay $2 for an hour. To use the remote for TV, also go downstairs and make a $20 deposit refundable at check-out. Coudn´t they charge the credit card?

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: nikyg1987
Reviews.Content: Nice warm welcome ! All staff we came in contact with were extremely helpfull and genuine. Nice family run hotel with a nice feel to it.Fantastic location-2 mins from bus/train station,close to cafes,restaurants etc. Would definately return if we go back to Rome. Big thank you to Bruna & Francesca  for assistance in booking sightseeing and restaurants. Be cautious with taxi's in Rome:they drive around endlessly ripping you off.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: bggoose
Reviews.Content: Booked this via Easyjet. Only 5 minutes walk from Rome Termini. The room was a good size as was the bathroom. It was also clean. The traffic noise is quite high even with the double glazing closed but after walking around Rome all day, we always managed a good night's sleep. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: Ruthcamin
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel due to the good reviews on tripadvisor and i' am happy i did.the staff Francesca and her sisters really gave me good instructions about restaurans, museums,shops.buffet breakfast is delicious:home Made cakes,juices,fruits,croissant ,cereals,ham and cheese and a machine for cappuccinos that allow you to' have 2 or 3 cappuccinos or more.the room a good size one althought a little noisy due to' the market.they arranged me transfer to' the airport,great service.i ' m sure i Will remeber this little place NeXT time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very nyce”
Reviews.Author: louisem70
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful.  The room was nyce and comfortable with a great bathroom.  Breakfast - ranged from cereal and yoghurt to breads ,salami and meat with cheese, yummy pastries and coffee machine of course!The location was excellent:getting there fron train station was  so easy. I would recommend Gabriella  to anyone wanting good value for their money:great deal for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: mlboul
Reviews.Content: We booked our room based on Fordor's comment and found the room very, very disappointing especially after traveling through Florence and Venice. The mattress was so thin you could feel the springs, we had to pad the mattress with 4 blankets to get some sleep. We were charged a 20 euro deposit for the TV remote. There were so many paper signs in the hallways about what you CAN'T do, and to have a 2nd cup of coffee at breakfast was an extra charge. We ended up eating at a cafe in the morning. Then to top it off our plans changed so we had to stay 2 extra nights in Rome, rather then move to another Hotel we decided to stay, another huge mistake. We were charged 40 euros more per night, alot more money than the surrounding hotels. But worse was reserving a taxi to the airport. Now the city of Rome has signs everywhere max rate is 40 Euros, the airport transport was 20 Euro, but the staff said they can only make reservation with the taxi and said it will be 50 Euros because we were leaving at 4:30 am. We agreed to the price. The next morning the taxi was 10 minutes late, the driver went upstairs for another 10 minutes. No taxi signs on the car or meter. The driver took the long route to the airport arriving at 5:50 am (it's only a 25 min ride) our flight was at 7am. When we arrived he said the charge was 65 Euros. I had to call the hotel and speak with the staff on my phone at my expense while they argued for another 5 minutes. My husband took our bags from the trunk telling the driver to take the 50 Euros or we will call the police. What a horrible ending to a wonderful vacation. I will never stay or recommend Hotel Gabriella. The location was OK, close to the train station and all the sites. Not such a nice area at night.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: squillybilly1979
Reviews.Content: We were here for 3 nights.Considering its unbeatable location (3m walk to central station), the neighboring is unbelievably quiet and pleasant.The room was clean and which is as my expectation, quiet and comfortable for the price i paid.The staff were very helpful and it felt like a little boutique family hotel.Breakfast offered good choices of yogurt, cereal, juices, and some fruit, with  croissants and rolls.I would definitely  recommend the Hotel Gabriella.

Reviews.Title: “Nyce and familiar”
Reviews.Author: MickM1975
Reviews.Content: The Hotel  is a no frills, but efficent and clean .Easy walking access to the centre and train station and transport,very good if you are  arriving from  the trainstation (5 minutes walk). Bus stop 50 meters from the hotel. Very friendly, pleasant staff, helpful and responsive. We arrived in the evening and had no problem finding the hotel. Before booking the hotel we had read some comments which complained about the lack of space in the room. However, we found our room spacious enough for a couple,good value for money, clean and comfortable. Breakfast is quite good,with a selection of cereals, fresh fruit, as well as the expected cheese and ham. It is a small familiar nice hotel, which we would always chose again for a stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “crook !!”
Reviews.Author: maurice p
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation through internet, along with the flight. Arriving, I found the deskpersonnel fairly professional, but certainly not the director, whom it was impossible to meet. "hot" water tepid ; room warming system operational (in december) from 5 to 7 pm ; breakfast strictly impossible : cheese and salami out of date, coffee with, solely, taste of plastic !! So I renounced breakfast but found it impossible to get repaid for it : 40€ lost, that is : 40€ robbed. please confirm this comment publicised, but I don't want receiving newsletter nor publicity. thank you. m papoular, grenoble, fr

Reviews.Title: “good location and fair price”
Reviews.Author: Tanyadl1974
Reviews.Content: Choose the hotel upon a friend suggestion.What I most liked was the location ,convenient to sight around .The area is full of hotels ,restaurants and café ,so If You're too tired you can easily find a place to take a break or have dinner.We've tried Mino' restaurant and I can say was the best among all.The Hotel served a decent breakfast so we've sticked with it. Room was nyce although a little bit small.Anyway hotel's staff was really nyce and customer friendly.Overall we've enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I stayed in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: Costantin B
Reviews.Content: Great staff,they helped me so much during my stay,good suggestions. Spacious room,cleaned daily,good towels and shampoo. Good buffet breakfast,with ham,cheese,cakes,yougurts,cereals fruit salads. Perfect location near Termini station,at a very low prices compared to other cities in Italy. A lovely market in the morning just down the hotel,buyed a lot of things.If your girlfrind loves market choose another place :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good service,good location”
Reviews.Author: Mikeyk1964
Reviews.Content: What we most liked about the hotel was the location, in a hub of activity and restaurants, near a supermarket, banks,convenient to buses and  you could reach everything extremely easily.We spent three nights in the hotel and had a lovely time,the room was very comfortable :we got exactly what we asked for, a quite room, non smoking. Clean bathroom with amenities and hairdryer. Flat-screen TV-, safe box.Breakfast was lovely (breads, pastries, meats, cheese, cereal, fruit)and  generous.The staff couldn't have been friendlier and informative,giving us tips,maps,and spoke excellent english!!extraordinarily helpful.Really good service.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: katherinema
Reviews.Content: The  location is very convenient: I walked from Railway station to Hotel (5 mins) and  centre is less than 20 mins walk as well.The ladies at the front desk were very helpful and quite friendly.Room was comfortable and breakfast was ok. Reasonable price and good service. I'll surely return!thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Linette S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this charming hotel last week,the room was spacious, and the bathromm spotlessy clean. The buffet breakfast included ham,cheese,salami,croissantes,fruit salad,delicious cakes. The staff went out of their way to help me to reconfirm the flight,and to reserve nice restaurants. The wi fi worked really well,and this is a plus but mandatory for me(I cannot live without the internet).Really apprecciated the bottle of wine for my Birthday. Thank you to the sisters they are really nice girls,also suggested me really good shops. I will remeber this hotel for my next trip in this lovely,romantic city!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Frederick1980
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this small and nyce hotel.The location was perfect near the Maine station,our room was fantastic with a mosaic bathroom,the breakfast was buffet and the air conditioned was in every part of the hotel .We love Rome was a great city and we enjoy our stay .We hope to' came back .

Reviews.Title: “hotel gabriella rome.......i wouldnt bother!”
Reviews.Author: morgandavies
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Gabriella for 4 nights in Sept. Package booking with Jet 2. Hotel close to Termini station for trains and buses, this was the reason why i gave it a 1 rating. I emailed the hotel to ask for a "nice" room as it was our 30th Wedding Anniversary. Firstly, the outside of the hotel is a complete mess, cigarette butts, food wrappings, cans, all sorts of rubbish right outside the front of the hotel by the steps. The room was very small on the front on the main road. No aircon or fan. Bathroom: - very tired -cleanliness just passable, door hanging off shower. Sink taps - only very slow dribble of water. Same in shower. Bedroom; wardrobe door hanging off. Decorating bad. Signs in breakfast room warning guests that they are only allowed to have one drink or will be charged extra.Breakfast not brilliant and tea and coffemaker tasted horrible. Warning if you get the room on the main road change it - there is a market every morning that sets up around 3.30am and if its hot and you have your windows open then you will never sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Gigy1960
Reviews.Content: The hotel we booked was a complete disaster,so we left it after 20 minutes,in the same street we found the ''Gabriella'' the had 1 room left so we decided to stay. The first impression was of a little clean hotel,but this was also a place were you can find all the best services of a quality hotel without payng a fortune.This is was the best hotel we stayed during our trip in Italy.The room was spacious and clean a flat tv a jacuzzi shower,a comfortable bed.The breakfast was delicious(cereals,breads,pastries,ham,salami,cheese,fruits,juices,coffee). The receptionist Fabienne spoke french,she was really helpful,and the maid jenny cleaned our room daily and changed towels!!!! We will come back for sure as Rome itself is a fantastic city!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for short time stay”
Reviews.Author: LilliMarleen
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in hotel Gabriella for a weekend (1 night) in the beginning of December 2011 and we were satisfied with the stay. It’s not the best hotel in that price range, but it’ also not the worst. Since we wanted to stay somewhere near Termini (main bus, train and metro station), we decided to book hotel Gabriella. It was good decision. Hotel is located within walking distance to Termini and it was great starting point for our wandering around Rome. Hotel Gabriella is located at the first floor of older building which also comprises other hotels. The reception area was at the time of our visit nicely decorated. The room was basic and clean as well as the bathroom. The most disappointing fact it was that when we returned from one of the trips around the city where we got caught by cold rain, there wasn’t hot water in the shower so I had shower with warm water (it wasn’t completely cold, but cold enough that I’m complaining about). During the summer that probably wouldn’t bother me, but in the winter it was annoying. Luckily the room was warm. Because of negative comments at trip advisor about the breakfast, we didn’t eat at the hotel. Apart from the receptionist we didn’t have contact with the staff. The receptionist was polite, but a little bit unprofessional since we had to wait about 20 minutes to get our bill and the key of the room, because she didn’t find the right papers. All in all, I think hotel Gabriela is ok for short time stay, but for a long time stay I would rather choose other hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and tidy - good base”
Reviews.Author: ctimes2
Reviews.Content: Walking distance of metro and main bus and rail stations. Used as a base to explore Rome so not there much. Room clean, shower very good, window opened onto to busy street so noisy at times. Would use again as a safe place to visit with teenage children.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for the welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: Luisagar
Reviews.Content: We,a couple of spanish and our little girl,stayed 5 nights in this small beatiful hotel.we arrived very late at night so we were tired and the gentleman at the reception immediately showed us our room.the room itself was modern even the bathroom,the only problem was the shower that was broken,but after we told they repair it the dame day.buffet breakfast was more american Style than italian,a lot of things to eat,and the lady that received us was always so kind.loved the beatiful view from breakfast room.we had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “I intend to be their guest every time I travel to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Janilot
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Gabriella for 3 winters almost in a row. I find it an excellent hotel in so many aspects: its location is wonderful, within walking distance not only to Roma Termini Station (very suitable to take the trains to the other cities I would visit), but also to other city's attractions. Gentle and efficiently helping staff, cozy comfortable and modern rooms, which underwent renovation recently, high quality well served breakfast! I intend to be their guest every time I travel to Rome. Oh, and there’s a very nice pasta Restaurant one and half block away (I think its name is Ristorante La Pretoriana), when you exit the Hotel you turn right and stay at same sidewalk.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Lilimarlin
Reviews.Content: My housband simply surprised me for our anniversary and took to' this lovely place for the week end.when we arrived was early so our room was not ready,we we're offered a drink in the lobby and we we're able to use the wi fi.our room was beautiful the bathroom amazing and new,the refrigerator and the flat tv a luxury taste!the buffet breakfasts were simply a great start:salami,cheese,ham,breads,croissantes,cereals,cakes,fruits,juices,cappuccinos as long as you want.a lovely market just outside the hotel was a surprise for me that i love all the markets.i will come back for sure thank you bruna fo the great suggestion of shops and restaurante.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost!”
Reviews.Author: BattyBugs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel, in combination with a flight from Venice to Rome. Our first impression was that it was not even worthy of 3 stars. The desk staff was gruff and unhelpful, even when it came to finding tours to take while we were there. Rome happened to be very warm, even though it was May. When we asked the desk clerk how to turn on the air conditioning (the room was hot on our arrival), we were told that they do not turn on the air conditioning until June 1st. That meant that we had to leave the window open, even while out of the room. Trying to sleep at night was useless. The bed was as hard as a rock and the pillows were flat, like pancakes. That, combined with the loud roar of traffic (all night) coming in the open window, made sleep impossible. The bathroom was small & the tiny, corner shower leaked, soaking the thin step-out towel provided as a bath mat. The "amenities" were useless & we consider them equal to the ones put in dumpy, flea-bag motels in the US. Not only that, they would not even provide wash cloths, for use in the shower. The desk clerk told us that we should use the hand towels in the shower. the last night we stayed, the TV was out. Oh, there were also not English language channels, at least we never found a channel in English. When we asked the clerk for a channel guide, or at least what the English channel numbers were, we were told that he didn't know, because they change all the time. Just another example of their lack of service. I could go on, but hopefully, our experience will help someone else not waste money on this place.

Reviews.Title: “One of the many small hotels around Termini station”
Reviews.Author: Victor_23041976
Reviews.Content: I have actually chosen to stay at Gabriella Hotel for it's location near Termini central station and because it was also suggested by Easyjet website. With the benefit of hind sight, I might have looked into the many other hotels that are found in the area before booking at Gabriella. This hotel is found on a quiet street - Via Palestro (at the intersection with Via Milazzo) - and this is a positive aspect because there are other hotels in the area with more noisy environment. Hotel Gabriella is found at the first floor of a historic building which also comprises other hotels. For about 80 euros per night, this is an affordable three-star hotel, but there are two factors which I found unsatisfactory. First, the price / booking did not cover breakfast, and second, the wi-fi service was very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, just a place to crash, don't expect anything else”
Reviews.Author: clinth
Reviews.Content: Just a stones throw distance from Termini is Hotel Gabriella, situated with other “hotels” in the same building by a busy road intersection. By saying that, I wasn’t really too disturbed by the traffic noises despite our room facing the traffic. When we arrived we were able to immediately go to our room, if you’re early they do have a storeroom to place your bags, which we took advantage of when we checked out. The staff at reception are very helpful despite the feeling that some look like they don’t really want to be there. Location wise its fine, and on most days there is a little market across the road from it as you walk to Termini. We didn’t feel worried at all about any danger, even later in the evening. It’s probably just the right distance away from some of the other dodgier establishments closer to Termini, which seem to have drunks hanging round – watch your valuables around Termini. You may find some interesting looking people hanging around the front door but ignore them and get out and experience Rome! The room is very basic. I have travelled through most of the major European cities and this room was by far the most basic. Makes some French rooms like palatial in comparison. However the bed was comfortable and the bathroom more than adequate, except the shower always leaked meaning I flooded my bathroom more than a couple times. Sure you can’t get any English TV channels but why go to Rome to watch BBC news? The breakfast “buffet” was embarrassing. A tiny table with a basket of croissants and a basket of bed. A plate with cheese triangles and one with condiments. There were a few not so tasty looking cereals there as well and some very watery squash. They did offer you one free hot drink – order more and they will charge you. In fact they left specific instructions about this rule everywhere; it felt like school or something! The hot chocolate was brilliant, and as we both ordered it we got a big jug of it – more than one each… which I wasn’t complaining about! The area has not many wonderful choices for restaurants. We went to one on the same street that spread out over a corner and it was awful. The one closest to the hotel, across the road and walk right about 3 minutes down was the best – it looks like a café. They had cabonara to die for. In fact everywhere else I went to in Rome had awful pasta in comparison, including pasta that was microwaved! In Rome? It’s outrageous. So I recommend this place if you want to eat on your way back to the hotel. Overall it was a place to crash every night and sleep, which it did fine. Would I go back? No. I think this place woke me up and made me realise I would pay more and stay somewhere better. I think Rome is a rip off city as it is, so I’d be careful paying too much more!

Reviews.Title: “Give this hotel a miss”
Reviews.Author: Mollie30
Reviews.Content: 3 star? No way The photographs on the website bore no resemblance to what it is actually like!!! We stayed here for 4 days and our room was basic, bed hard, TV didn't work as they hadn't the right satellite!! All we wanted was an English speaking news channel but they couldn't find one - wires hanging down from the TV all down the wall Bed hard - hardly got any sleep - near reception - very noisy at night. Had to keep the curtains closed as our room overlooked the most appalling courtyard - filthy and full of rubbish - absolutely disgusting. So we had to keep the curtains closed at all times, no fresh air - felt like a prison cell. Lighting very poor and dull. What this room is like in summer doesn't even bear thinking about. Bathroom not too bad - toilet seat had a burn on it - shower was broken and had to be handheld in order to wash your hair. No hot water in basin. However, nice towels and clean and warm. Breakfast appalling - one choice of cereal which we didn't try as it looked old, fruit juice was squash, coffee awful, no meat or cheese, just jam and cold croissants - nice little coffee shop down the road near the bus terminus where all the locals go. The ladies on reception were very helpful and friendly and there is a lovely wine bar/pizza restaurant around the corner where we had 3 delicious meals. Hotel is well situated though but I would never recommend it to anyone and Easy Jet shouldn't have it on their website

Reviews.Title: “Stay here but be aware......”
Reviews.Author: rickwal
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this hotel after spending 4 days in Rome, the hotel is very close to the Termini station, in fact when you come out of the hotel you can see it, its about 3 mins walk, previous reviews have said about the area being unsafe but I have to say we walked around at night and didnt once feel unsafe, you are surrounded by other hotels, restaurants and a police station. Checking in was a breeze, our room was clean and comfortable, the staff were mostly friendly although we were out most of the time so I didn't see a lot of them, the only downsides was the noise of the traffic if you do want to get a quick nap but i suppose this is typical of Rome, the toiletries in the room were not refreshed and when we asked for some were told that the cupboard was locked and finally, the breakfast buffet was not that good, cereal, rolls, cheese spread butter, I had read that it was a nicer buffet, the one morning they had fruit salad I got told off for using the wrong size bowl! in the end it felt as though you were being watched and we just got it, ate quickly and got out. I would recommend this hotel for its location, comfort and cleanliness but not sure if I would stay here again as there were so many others around the area I'd probably try a different one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, but beware of the night porter if you return to hotel late!”
Reviews.Author: SICKASADOG2
Reviews.Content: For - This hotel is in a great location for the train and bus terminals, less than 5 minute walk, All the major sites are within walking distrance. Clean. It is true that you have to pay for an extra coffee or tea at breakfast, but if you order a cafe latte, you get at least two cups anyway. Lots of coathangers. Mini bar not too expensive, plus there's room to put your own stuff in too. Most of the staff are friendly and helpful. Against - 20 euro deposit required for air conditioning remote control for some rooms. If you're given room 36, just refuse. You can barely get round the bed as the room is so small. Hardly room to open the fridge door either. One night did want to have a night cap with friends (who were also stahing at the hotel) in the room, but the night porter wouldn't allow them through. No tea/coffee making facilities in the room so take your travel kettle if you're partial to a cuppa. Overall it was OK. We only paid £60 per night, per couple, bed and breakfast and feel we had great value for money. The name sickasadog2 stems from an awful trip to the Reef Oasis Hotel in Sharm el Sheikh, so please don't be put off.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: margaret1122
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were met with the sight of rubbish and household waste littered across the front hall. The building this hotel is in is shared with approximately 4 other hotels, Hotel Gabriella being situated on the 3rd floor, there is a shared lift between all the hotels in the complex and the lift is very cramped with only room for 1 person + bag. The lobby was tiny and in need of some modernization. Our room was clean but small, the bathroom towel rack was broken, we got 1 stick of soap and 1 sachet of shampoo which was not replaced on a daily basis for the entire stay and also toilet roll was never replaced. The T.V in our friends room was broken with wires hanging out of the back, it had to be fixed twice and still did not work so we gave up asking. Breakfast was typical continental with guests only allowed 1 cup of tea or coffee, if you wanted any more you had to pay for it which really annoyed us. The location was good being very close to the termini (train station). However junkies slept outside the station at night and you could encounter problems so be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ComedyNightDuo
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying in this hotel in February. It was quiet, comfortable and good value for money. Staff were helpful. Location was good and most of the City sights were within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “clean good location staff all speaks english good value for money”
Reviews.Author: terry_wilson
Reviews.Content: right next to Rome Terminal, Great location to Metro A and B lines easy to walk, very clean and safe. Will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Definately will stay again”
Reviews.Author: LuisaPoulter
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here for about a week, the location is perfect for first time visitors to Rome. We walked to the colossuem, trevi fountain, pantheon, etc. The only one we didnt walk to was the Vatican. Hotel is 5 minute walk to termini which was perfect. Plenty of restaurants and bars in the area, laundromat across the road. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. The room was cleaned every day, fresh towels. Breakfast was more than enough for me although my husband prefers more a hearty breakfast. We will definately stay here again on our next trip. The area is very noisy, but close the window and shutters at night, you dont hear a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jimravc
Reviews.Content: We used the Hotel Gabriella for a one night stay in Rome following a cruise. We arrived a bit early and were immediately upgraded to a larger room based on the amount of luggage we had from the 12 night cruise. This is a very basic hotel by American Standards, but was clean and comfortable and quite. Location is only four blocks from the central train and bus depot and neighborhood had many great little sidewalk cafes and restaurants. If you can put aside your American expectations you will find this is an excellent value in a great location. Would definetely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Strictly Okay”
Reviews.Author: UptownGirl24
Reviews.Content: The hotel is build in a typical old stone building... has friendly staff... quite welcoming and prompt. Rooms are strictly okay... small actually, and the telephone in the room was not working. However, the breakfast is much better for such a budget hotel... so you can be sure of a decent spread of breakfast.... and the chef is friendly. I stayed in hotel Gabriella last summer... I was in Rome on business and needed a hotel close to the Termini Station. The hotel is not as close to the Termini Station as indicated in the description. It is about 4 lanes away... around 500 meters from Termini... although the distance is not much... the lanes get secluded... making it slightly lonely a street to walk... especially in winter... However, in summer it is good hotel to stay in... budget hotel... around 80 to 100 Euros a night... if you are two people staying it works out cheap. The Termini station market provides a good spread of food... so you wont starve even if you are late for dinner. Shopping malls, restaurants a plenty around... I had a lovely stay at the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a frightening dump”
Reviews.Author: tarkin
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on the description on booking.com. This place was frightening. The room had scuff marks all over the walls, a light bulb was missing, and it was hot as hell. The staff refused to turn on air conditioning. After going out for a bit to eat, we felt extremely unsafe in the neighborhood. We immediate returned and left the hotel. The staff refused to issue a refund. I've filed a dispute with my credit card company. Stay away from this place. Beware any hotel that wants to charge you up front. There is no way on earth this is a three star hotel. It should be one star.

Reviews.Title: “Gabriella ok for price”
Reviews.Author: AKQ
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in Hotel Gabriella. When we first arrived we were given a room at the end of the hall on the floor above reception. This room was a strange shape and very noisey as overlooking busy street. The bathroom was a good size and clean but only had a bath with a hand held shower and no curtain. We asked to be moved to a room with a shower and were given a smaller room behind reception. We prefered this room even though we had less space as it was at the back and very quiet from street noise. The bathroom had no bath but had a shower. It was spotless and basic toiletries were provided. Hairdryer on wall was in bad shape and didnt work ( I brought my own luckily) and toilet roll holder was missing. Bed was very comfortable with crisp,clean linen. Air conditioning worked well. As the room was close to breakfast room we were disturbed early every morning as staff prepared breakfast. They spoke in loud voices with no regard for people sleeping in rooms close by. Breakfast itself was dissapointing after the good reviews on tripadvisor. It was very basic and my husband said the coffee was not good. Staff in general were pleasent and helpful about ordering taxis etc. This hotel is handy for Termini station and we found the metro easy and fast to use. The area is not the prettiest but there are a couple of nice, reasonabley priced restaurents nearby. One or two do good breakfasts too. All in all this hotel was ok for a budget hotel but if we were to return to Rome we would try to find a hotel near the Spanish steps which is a lovely area.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: pottylorraine
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with the Gabriella Hotel and I honestly feel that a number of the reviews either had a very different room then we had or the hotel has really dropped its standards. We were told that it was a three star hotel and I would barely give it a two. Our Room #20, was just down the hall from the reception area. When we opened the door we just about passed out from the heat. When we couldn't figure out how to turn on the air conditioner my husband went back to the receptionist who told him that the air conditioner didn't work in that room. He asked for a room where it did work and was told not to worry, the air conditioning wasn't turned on until June anyway. We opened the window onto a very noisy street. The room actually had a smell to it and I noticed mold in the bathroom around the shower and also around the window. I actually took pictures of the mold. The hallways have Air Freshener sprays and wicker oil scents to mask odors. The breakfast was included in the price and was mediocre. You are only allowed one tea or coffee but the servers were pleasant. The bed was not very comfortable but I couldn't sleep just because the heat was terrible in the room. The shower was the smallest I have ever been in and my ballet training came in very well when I dropped the soap and had to do a demi-plie to get it. I think the maid did her best to keep it clean but the ventilation caused the mold problems. The elevator is also very small but beats hauling your suitcase up to your room.. The Hotel is close to Rome Termini the main rail and Metro station. The area is a little seedy but adequate. We were very happy to check out and head to the airport where we found our plane was overbooked and we were then given a lovely room at the Hilton. I certainly would not recommend this hotel. Even in my back-packing youth, I wouldn't pay the money they asked for the poor room we received.

Reviews.Title: “Great room at great location”
Reviews.Author: ottawafan
Reviews.Content: I chose the Hotel Gabriella based on price and proximity to Termini Station. It turned out to be a good choice. The room was excellent with the bed being very comfortable. The bathroom was clean and well-appointed. Breakfast was very good with lots of selection. The area near the hotel has very good restaurants, great little stores, and wonderful people at the Internet Cafes. On some mornings, there is a delightful market set up just in front.

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful find!”
Reviews.Author: Lovedthecity
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Gabriella for 3 nights at the end of January! Booked due to all the good reviews on this site! We were not disappointed. The room we had # 18 was spacious and very immaculate,warm in winter season,and the bathroom was updated and with a modern jacuzzi shower(we really loved after a long day of walking tours)fluffy towels changed daily. The breakfast had more than enough to offer for us(fresh juice,cappuccino,rolls,croissants,cereals,ham,salami,cheese) and the breakfast room was so lovely facing the nyce market just down the street. The service was great,Bruna helped us a lot with suggestion of reaustaurants(try Armendo)and good shopping areas,nothing is too much for her,she even reserve a last minute tour of the Vatican for us,we were glad she did as we saw the long line we missed.Definitely a 5 star service at a 3 star price. Will return as soon as we can!

Reviews.Title: “Just Go For It”
Reviews.Author: A_NDubai
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Gabriella. It was VERY easy to find using the map provided on the website. The neighborhood was safe and 2 minutes walking distance to Termini. Very good location I must say. We were warmly welcomed by ALL the staff. They were very kind and friendly with a very good English. The room was reasonably sized with a nice view. Toilet was also clean. We stayed for four nights at Hotel Gabriella. Breakfast was included in the price but due to our very early morning plans to see Rome, we only managed to have it in day 4. That's when I figured out how much we MISSED the first three days. It was really good. One thing which also worths mentioning here about this hotel is that they use high security measures I actually haven't seen in the rest of the hotels we stayed at during our trip. Which adds up a plus to Gabriella. I would surely come back again. Good job Hotel Gabriella.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PabloFiascoWales
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Gabriella for four nights in November 2007. We selected the hotel after reading previous reviews in Tripadviser. This was another example of good advice from travellers who have stayed at the hotel. We received a warm welcome from Barbara in reception when we arrived, she provided us with information maps and advice. The room we stayed in (18) was furnished to a very high standard with an excellent bathroom. The towels provided were top quality and changed frequently. The owner of the hotel, Romelo was exceptionally helpful in providing us with information with directions to all the places of interest and even making a phone call for us to visit the Villa Borghese Museum, which was very much appreciated. The breakfast room was very spacious and provided a vast selection of various food, as described by previous guests. The location of the hotel is ideal, as it is only within 3 - 5 mins walk from the Termini Station. All the main places of interest are within walking distance from the hotel. We even walked to the Vatican City (We are both in our 60s). I would recommend this hotel to all visitors to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great shower, strong and hot. Good location”
Reviews.Author: KonaVirginia
Reviews.Content: Well located within walking distance from Rome Termini. Elevator was out of order so required a one story walk up. Clean and comfortable family run operation. Very good water pressure and plenty of hot water. Pleasant service and hospitalbe management. Good price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there !”
Reviews.Author: Lily78Geneva
Reviews.Content: Never go there ! We had the worst experience in years of travels. We booked a last minute stay of 5 days there with Rates To Go. When we arrived and saw that the dirty hall of the building (which contain many differents hôtels), the very small room, the poor state of the bathroom, walls and furniture, the noisy place... we tried to obtain a shorter stay. It was impossible to obtain any other arrangement with them ! The only thing we obtain was to move the second day to another room, slightly better, but having a fantastic view on a dirty yard ! Where you could at night hear students screaming, smell the cigars, and fell a ventilation pushing hot air in our room...We could not open our windows and we where sufocating at night. Add to this a shower with cold water (presented like a thalasso one !), the bad phonic isolation, and poor quality breakfast... We had to pay 210 euros for that ! We where three (2 adults and 1 teenager). In the room, it was indicated 150 euros for two. We never see somewhere printed the price for a room for three... We think we have been seriously robbed !!!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: sunflowers1128
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome and the Hotel Gabriella. Unfortunately it was a last minute booking so we didn't have much choice. I agree with other reviews it is close to Termini, which makes it accessible to everything. We stayed in the same area last year (different hotel) and found it safe at night with many great, reasonable restaurants in the area. (Try "Al 39 at #39 via palestro) Now to the hotel review, I must say it was clean, fresh towels/sheets everyday, however our room was like a prison cell!! It was on the inside facing a courtyard, but couldn't tell since the window/shutters couldn't open therefore no external light. The noise at night (from the youth hostel in the basement) and in the morning from the staff arranging breakfast was bad. Also, one day we were back at the hotel around 1pm, and the staff/family? were having their lunch in the breakfast room, loud talking, plates rattling, kids, screaming!!! Tough to have a lie down before going out again after lunch!! One good thing was the breakfasts, there was plenty of food and variety, which is a rarity in Italy. Also found the male staff ( son/father etc) not very approachable, luckily didn't have to ask them much since we knew are way around. All around, I doubt I will return to the Gabriella anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: leasildk
Reviews.Content: I' ve recently been to Rome, and decided to stay in this small but very clean and well located place. The staff is young and always available to give useful information. The breakfast is excellent. I highly recommend to every tourist who want a good place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base BUT....”
Reviews.Author: WEENJOYTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our 4 day stay in Rome at this hotel. Overall I would say that hotel Gabriella is OK/good, certainly 2 star and probably 3. First the positives - Location -Whichever airport you come into - they'll all run buses to Rome Termini station , and this hotel is very short walking distance from there, so good access and fine base. Make sure you buy a metro pass and use it well...it'll save your feet! The staff are very friendly - its a family run hotel - and make you feel at home...the place is small enough that you feel you are being looked after personally. Our room was clean and tidy, good airconditioning and nice bathroom. Now the downsides - We paid around 120 Euros a night - and thats top price for what you get (you may get it cheaper if you're lucky!) - the room was very small (we had room 3) - just enough room for the bed and tiny TV - and although the bathroom was spacious and looked nice, things needed repair - broken hairdryer, toilet seat and tap. The main problem was noise in the morning - there is a market right outside in the street every day - and it woke us up at 6am setting up each morning...PLUS...the noise from the kitchen preparing breakfast was very loud each day. So...you were woken up each day EARLY! Make sure you ask for a quiet room when you book (if there is one!). Finally a tip or two for your Rome trip - AVOID the Termini car/bus park after dark....its v dodgy area - give it a wide berth! Walk through the station itself to get from one side to the other (its really nice inside!) - outside it's a center for local gypsies and drunks. DO take an open-topped audio tour bus ride around the city on the Red-line bus - a great way to see Rome. Dont be tempted to use the other open-topped buses - what they dont tell you is that they dont run nearly as often as the Red Line ones - so not as good for getting on and off. DO go up the dome at St Peters...the views are outstanding...but take the lift half way...you'll see what I mean! Cheers & enjoy ROMA.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful anniversary trip!”
Reviews.Author: lazydaze22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Gabriella and had a very nice stay. I requested Room # 3 (which they were happy to reserve for us) and it was much more spacious than our Venice and Florence hotels (a little smaller than a typical American double room). It had Jacuzzi jets on the box shower that were so nice after a long day of walking (we walked everywhere in the city!). We loved the breakfast every morning; croissants, pastries, rolls, meats, cheese, bread, cereal, yogurt, fruit, fresh juices. It was just a few blocks up from the middle part of Termini station, so very accessible for transportation. We didn't have any problem with the Termini area and it actually came in very handy. A couple of nights we got in late and there were several take-away pizza/kebob places open until 3am, a laundromat, and a pharmacy (I got very sick and this was wonderful to have right there!) all on the same street. A few nights it was a little noisy late at night, but once we shut the window we had no problem. We never found a time when the computer was on when we wanted to use the internet, but you could access it for free 20 min a day in the sitting room. The day we left they let us keep our luggage there after we checked out and we ended up spending much longer in the city than originally planned, so our luggage was there till 7pm without a problem. It was our first anniversary and on the last night we walked into the room to find a bottle of chilled champagne and two big chocolate Easter eggs waiting on the desk, compliments of the Gabriella. Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ForzaHUFC
Reviews.Content: We chose this excellent hotel after balancing the reviews of tripadvisor and booking where the hotel was booked through. For information, our stay was 5 nights. The location is only 5 minutes from Rome's main train station, making access from either airport easy. Also access to the metro, regional and national trains, buses and tourist buses is all based around the train station, therefore access to Rome and further is easy. The hotel from arrival impressed. The front desk were friendly, spoke English, therefore my pigeon Italian was nt needed and also provided maps, leaflets etc. The desk also appeared to be staffed 24hours. Our room was large, with an excellent bed, large wardrobes, plenty of sockets and draws, a mini fridge (which was nt overstocked allowing us to store our own water etc, and was actually fair priced, 2 euros for a 330cl can of beer). the best bit tho was the excellent bathroom, large, clean. The breakfast was more than ok, excellent coffee, choice of meats, cheeses, yougurts, cerial etc, along with croissants and filled croissants. The area although busy was nt too noisey and outside, in the morning market stalls lined the streets which were fun and reasonable, a silk italian tie cost 5 euros! there are many excellent and fair priced restraunts, bars and snack bars in the area. Wea ate in the area numerous times and enyojed all meals, in fact they were the best meals we had in Rome. The hotel staff were excellent, friendly and helpful, contacting a tour company for us when it looked as if they were nt going to show up and pick us up as arranged. In summary this is an excellent hotel, especially for the price. * excellent accomodating staff * excellent sized room and room facilities * excellent access to Rome, transportation, restraunts etc

Reviews.Title: “dirty, sketchy hostel”
Reviews.Author: normak
Reviews.Content: From the pictures on the internet it looks fine. As I walked up these beautiful marble steps I was proud of my find until i turned the coner to see a neon blue sign and a tiny office desk. The bathrooms were filthy and had no hot water. It says 15 min free interent bu it's not even in the building. You have to rent towels for a $1 and it's a pesky hand towel. The elevator is super sketchy to get up to your room and there is only one key to share between the other room mates. So whoever goes out late has to wake the others up when they get in. ALso the address was so small on the building we spent 15 min walking around knowing we were in the right spot. It was super frustrating just coming off a plane. The yellow hostel is just down the street and it's amazing! fun lounge, free internet, a bar. I was extremely jealous of the friends i met that were staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice roman Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: StenKristian
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Rome for our honeymoon. 6 nights we stayed at the Gabriella Hotel. We arrived by train to the Roma Termini and walked just for 5-10 minutes to find the hotel.The staff welcommed us with a big smile and some cold drink. The hotel was perfect for our stay. Lots of small nice restaurants in the area and a perfect locations to get around in Rome. Renate og Kristian Palmesen, Norway

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: kiwitravellor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights end of Sept to Oct 06. We had a fantastic stay. Staff were awesome and very helpful. Went out of there way to help. The hotel didnt look too nice from the outside (the street was the same) but we realised thats just Rome because to our delight inside was very very nice, very bright and welcoming. Our room was a 4 bedroom and it was very roomy and the cleanest room we stayed in on our 5 week journey around Europe. The bathroom also was big and also very clean and made the end of our journey a bonus. Beds were very comfortable and we had a great nights sleep. Breakfasts included in the price were a treat to look forward to, not an english breakfast but when in Rome.... They make a nice cuppuchino and a lovely cup of tea (which seems to be hard to find in Rome). Service was excellent they were so helpful. We were able to store our bags with no trouble at all. Security was good here too and we always felt safe. Put it this way it was a lovely hotel to come back to after a busy day out walking and sightseeing. This hotel is close enough to the Termini station to walk with luggage and in the street opposite was a cool little market most days. The bonus about being close to the train station is that using the metro was easy and was easy to get to to go to the airport. Was also some nice places down the street for dinner. We would definately stay here again wihthout doubt. Many thanks to great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: partassa
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of the fantastic reviews on this website. All was perfect from the check in,the man at the reception went out of his way to welcome us,we found a bottle of wine in our room,great. The room was clean and well decorated,with a flat tv and a jacuzzi shower. Breakfast was more than we exspected,cheese,salami,croissantes,yogourts,tomatoes,cereals,fruits. I hope to come back soon and I will remember always the help of Bruna the lady at the reception,that helped us to find restaurants and shops. Thank you Hotel Gabriella

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: silvaleandro
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel, very well located, with a beautifull young staff, and a receptionist who spokes also portuguese (witch was nice considering that it is my mother tong). The room was very clean, with air conditioning (essential, considering in that period was very hot in the city), and a flat screen tv. Tha breakfast had an excellent choice of fruits and the essencial: an excellent italian capuccino. It will be with no doubt my reference for my next stay in Rome, and am planning tu return soon, because i could not see everithing in just 5 days.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elsiera
Reviews.Content: great little hotel in Rome. Excellent location, 10 minutes to central rome, 2 mins to the main railway station. Lots of restaurants within easy walking distance. Processing at reception was done with ease, staff are very helpful and considerate. Breakfast is good, the coffee was really good! The rooms are a decent size, air conditioning worked well, good size shower with shampoo and soap provided. The bed was comfy too, rooms serviced to a good standard every day.

Reviews.Title: “better than a 2 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Eirel79
Reviews.Content: my sister and i stayed at the hotel in early june- i chose this hotel after reading reviews in tripadvisor- i thought that a hotel that responded to comments on tripadvisor must really care about their establishment- i was happy to be right- the hotel was clean- the staff were excellent! they all spoke english but also greeted you in italian - the breakfast was good- right when we arrived, they gave us complementary drinks and a guide to the city- internet was free! the room was beautiful w/its light and flat screen tv- the bathroom did not have a towel rack but the the 2nd day we were there- one was installed- we especially like the massage shower! i was surprise this only got a 2 star- this hotel was much better than some others in the US or other countries considered to be 3 stars! the bus stop is just around the corner and termini station a few blocks away for easy transportation- there is only one small elevator but that was not a problem- and lastly the price for almost a whole week of stay was not too bad- its affordable- overall, we would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “WORST EVER”
Reviews.Author: NRC1
Reviews.Content: We understood the hotel to be reasonably priced. It is very close to the train station...however when we arrived the hotel was housed with several hostels and very difficult to access. The rooms smelled and were tiny. We asked for a larger room and were told one was available for an additional charge which would be expected...35 euro additional, making this barely above a hostel 200 euro a night. We got into the quad room and it smelled and had absolutely no character at all. When i went to use the restroom, someone ' not us had been there before and it was not liquid. The girl argued that she had had the room cleaned and she had no way to know it was not ours....OH MY GOD !!!!!!! We quickly evacuated the hotel but not without being charged the full rate of the larger room where we spent no longer than 10 minutes in it. i could have perhaps understood the 165, but no way 200. They were very indignant and rude, however the employee did call us a taxi to make our getaway...unless you want a hostel, do NOT book this excuse for a 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I stayed at the hotel for the first 5 nights of our honeymoon. The room we stayed in was very spacious and the bathroom was clean and had plenty of room. The staff at the hotel went above and beyond to help us get our lost luggage back from the Rome airport. Without their help, I don't think we would have been able to enjoy our stay in Rome!!!! I highly recommend this to anyone that is looking to stay in Rome to sightsee. The hotel is located near the train station which made our travels very easy.

Reviews.Title: “You have to know what you get”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome. My wife and i staid for two nights at the end of May. As it was my wifes birthday and it was a surprise to her, i had to decide myself which hotel to choose. I faced two problems: First the hotel prices in Rome are incredible high and as we are anyway all day out and only stay at the hotel to change clothes, take a shower or sleep, i did not want to spent too much money for the hotel but safe it for sightseeing and restaurants. Second when i found Hotel Gabriella the reviews showed two sides of a medal - very positive ones and then some which were completely horrable. Being from the tourism business myself i understand that there are alway guests, who are not satisfied with anything and expect more than they are willing to pay. So when we travelled i was a little bit doubtful if this was the right choice. But i can assure you that if you compare the price-service-benefit ratio Hotel Gabriella is a good choice. I did not find any argument against it. And all negative reviews seem to me to be incorrect. Hotel Gabriella is situated some blocks (maybe 3-5 minutes walking) from Termini (main train) station. It gives you perfect access to all public transportation in Rome and is also easy to reach from the airport. Although some previous guest felt unsecure, we were on the way even during night time returning from Dinner or walking. We passed Termini station and all the side streets but never had the feeling of unsecurity. Everthing was ok. Be prepared that the building is shared by three hotels. Hotel Gabriella seemed to us to be renovated shortly and our room (according to the reception a standard one) was good. Relatively new furniture, clean room as well as the bathroom, not to much space to move, but sufficient if you want to use the Hotel for the purpose described. The breakfast was good, fresh rolls, cheese and ham, a variety of cereals, joghurt, fresh fruit and butter, marmelade etc. Coffee was great and you could choose either American, Capuccino etc. Staff was friendly and helpful, all questions were answered and i do not have any complaint. In case prices are still that high, we would probably stay again at Hotel Gabriella as it offers (for Rome) quite a good price-service ratio.

Reviews.Title: “passable accomadations at gabriella”
Reviews.Author: quic630
Reviews.Content: room was a postage stamp couldnt move in the shower, good breakfast, personal service, close to termini, be carefull on the metro .....hey you get what you pay for..under rehabing at time of posting

Reviews.Title: “room 2 noisy due to the closeness of the breakfast-room”
Reviews.Author: Angelo1
Reviews.Content: Room nbr2 is noisy early in the morning ( starting from 7 a.m. ) because very close to the breakfast room . It seems that service personnel working in the breakfast room don't take much care of this closeness.Out of this no other major problems.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in May 2006 after reading some of the reviews on this website. While the accommodations met my expectations for a 2 star hotel, I was fairly disappointed with the service from the staff and it left me with a somewhat sour impression. The pros of this hotel are: 1. Rooms are decent size and the bathroom fixtures were new. The shower was especially nice (great water pressure!) and there was always hot water. 2. Our TV did not work initially but someone came in to look at it right away and it was fixed in 10 minutes. 3. It is 4 blocks from Termini station (about a 5 mins walk) and therefore, you have easy access to the metro, train station, buses, etc. 4. A variety of restaurants located along Via Palestro (same street as the hotel) and all are open fairly late (especially recommend the Bistro, we had a fantastic meal there). The cons of this hotel are: 1. Most of Rome's key sites are not within easy walking distance. The Colosseum, Spanish Steps and Pantheon are easily 20-30 mins away but you are close the Metro so there are alternatives. I simply personally prefer to walk most places. 2. The breakfast was good with great coffee but the service was awful. The tables were not cleared on a timely basis and on two seperate occasions, an elderly gentleman that worked at the hotel was quite rude to us for no apparent reason. On the first day he asked what we wanted to drink and i asked if they made cappuchinos or lattes (i had seen them on other people's tables) to which he rudely replied, i have coffee and milk, you can put it together yourself - then stalked off in a huff. He then returned to tell me very rudely, to put my yogurt container in the bins on the tables even though i had just peeled off the lid to start eating! The next day, he was behind the coffee counter when i walked by and he yelled at me, "What do you want, coffee, tea, what?" I was only pouring myself juice and had not even spoken to him to deserve such attitude. I noticed he had the same demeanor towards other patrons of the hotel so tried not to take it personal. 3. Rooms were not cleaned very thoroughly. I noticed on several days that they appeared to have restocked the bathrooms and re-arranged the towels but had not cleaned the actual fixtures. Overall, I probably would not stay here again given my experiences. The hotel offers good quality for a 2 star, but the service leaves something to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: riverwater
Reviews.Content: We knew this would be a budget hotel but even so it was the same price as a luxurious 4* in Sorrento. Rome hotels are not cheap. Before we booked I wondered why the reviews fell into two camps, very enthusiastic or cross. Now I see why! Against: The hotel was being renovated. There was no ceiling in the passageway and work began there about 8am in the morning. We had wires and pipes sticking out of the walls of our room (to be fair, we did come back one day and find a radiator had appeared). Some of the wires looked longstanding, though. We did not wish to sit on the only chair in the room as it had rather a disquieting stain on it. Our bedroom was quite small and dark, we could hardly get round the bed. There wasn't a lot of storage space. The bed linen was clean but sparse - we only had a sheet and (for some reason) two thin satin bedspreads. The next day one of the bedspreads had disappeared. I found a blanket in the wardrobe but it was dirty and stained. The towel rail fell off in the bathroom. The service in the breakfast room was charming but sometimes erratic. For: the location is good, walking distance to Termini and lots of buses. The area could seem a bit daunting but we had no problems (apart from pickpockets at the bus station). The local cafes were friendly and the receptionist recommended a nice restaurant to us. The double glazing on the windows did a very good job at blocking out the traffic noise.The bathroom was newly done and the shower was fabulous, much better than our home one! The bedroom and bathroom were clean. The breakfast room was clean and light. The breakfast was good, but sometimes things ran out and they didn't notice for a bit, so perhaps that is why some people liked the breakfast and some thought it was sparse. The reception staff were pleasant. I think if the owners spent a night in each of the hotel's rooms they would see what small but crucial improvements could be made, and understand why they get mixed reviews sometimes. If it was me I would just add lots of huge mirrors, light and bright colour schemes, good lighting, better bed linen, and some contemporary posters. I would also move the furniture to minimise the effect of a large bed in a small room. I think if the renovations are completed to a good standard and they look at the details of the rooms they provide this could be a good choice for a few days in Rome. I think perhaps some of the other rooms might have been larger or better than ours. We wouldn't return to it as it was, though. We just felt a bit flat about our choice of hotel, somehow. I suppose if it had been cheap we would not have been picky, but it hurts when you've paid quite a lot for it!

Reviews.Title: “Quite disappointed”
Reviews.Author: BazHokie
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews for this hotel on Tripadvisor...I thought we were walking into a "can't miss" hotel that was near the train station. But, when my wife and I walked in...we honestly thought we may have had the wrong hotel all together. Thank God we were only staying for one night. First of all, it appeared that the Gabriella was undergoing some renovation and improvements. So, *perhaps* this review should be taken with a slight grain of salt if the room we stayed in was one of the rooms left they haven't gotten around to upgrading yet. When we tried opening the door to the lobby, it was locked, and we noticed a sign (handwritten on a piece of white paper) that the lobby had moved to another room. The new "lobby" was a makeshift office that was in the corner of another room (dining room I believe) that consisted of a man at a desk with a computer and phone on it. The man was nice enough though when we checked-in...and offered to help me with the bags we were carrying. The man from the desk took us to our room (on the same floor as the lobby), gave us the key, and bid goodbye to us at the door. When we opened the door to the room, we were instantly disappointed. The room had the a very cheap Motel 6 kind of feel. There was barely enough room to get around to the other side of our bed (that's how small the room was). It was dark, dingy...and again...very cheap looking. To make matters worse, nothing inside the room seemed to work: A/C: nope (thankfully, it wasn't too hot yet) TV: nada Lamps: only one of them worked Windows: hard to open/close Now, even though the room was dingy...the bathroom looked like it had been renovated somewhat recently. However, renovation doesn't necessarily mean better. This was perhaps the most poorly designed/engineered bathroom I had ever seen. First, the shower stall was just inches in front of the toilet...so if you were sitting on the toilet, you had to point your legs sideways just to fit in. Second, the sink faucet was so short that it barely jutted out beyond the rim of the sink. You literally had to jam your hands up against the sink basin in order to get underneath the faucet to wash your hands. (See included pictures). Who designs bathrooms like this? As I mentioned before, we were only staying there for one night...since we were catching a flight home to the US the next morning (this was the end of our Italy trip). And we definitely tried to minimize our time in the hotel room during that day. The area outside of our hotel didn't exactly make my wife and I feel like it was the safest area either. We did get up in time to catch the free breakfast in the morning...but we decided to pass on it when we walked by the buffet. Unspectacular to say the least. Overall, I would have to say that my wife and I were extremely disappointed. I hope (for the hotel's sake) that since we were only staying for 1 night...they decided to give us one of the worst rooms of the house. Still, if staying there means that you could be stuck with one of those rooms, I don't know if I would want to gamble to stay there again. We didn't feel like complaining and/or asking for a different room since: A) We were only staying for 1 night B) The Gabriella is supposed to be only a 2-star hotel anyways I was just disappointed that the quality of room didn't seem to coincide with what the TripAdvisor reviews was representing (which is a little rare). My wife and I had stayed at the Hotel Dei Mellini for our first 3 days in Rome...and we absolutely loved it there. Pros: Only 3 blocks from Roma Termini (can walk there) Cons: Dingy, cheap room where nothing works...poorly designed bathroom....lackluster breakfast....renovations going on in April 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gabriella was a great place to stay in Rome. It was near to the main train station, so not far to walk to the metro. The room we were in faced the road, but the shutters and double glazing stopped any noise from coming in.Also a good market outside. We had A/C aswell, and that was a god send. The room itself was very clean, the bed was big and comfortable and the maids changed the linen everyday. The bathroom was also very clean. The staff were friendly and recommended a really nice place to eat too. Rome isn't too big so you can walk to most places, and Gabriella was in a good location. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: CarolJJ
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I wanted to stay somewhere central and safe in Rome and Hotel Gabriella fitted the bill nicely. Situated about 5 minutes from Termini Station on a quiet street, the hotel's reception was on the first floor. Our room was spotless, well-furnished and (I'm glad to say) air-conditioned. Staff were friendly and helpful, all spoke English and we could leave our bags at the hotel after we had checked out for some more essential sightseeing. The decent continental breakfast was served in a pleasant breakfast room. We shall definitely come here again. Very good value for a 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rome great but hotel and location disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We researched extensively and we saw that the Gabriella had a series of reviews on Trip Advisor that were all raving about this place. We thought we could not go wrong with the great reviews!!! So we booked there. When we arrived and opened that hotel room door, we were slightly disappointed. Now we are not aware of what the other rooms were like but we spent the first hour in the room calling other hotels to get a better place, but they were all booked. (We later asked if all the rooms were a similar size and they replied that they were). Slight disappointment. We realised we should have spent €180/200 a night. The room was small. There was literally a few feet from the foot of the bed to the furniture. The decor was a bit boring with the usual lower end hotel style look, furniture was a bit bland. Walls in room were slightly dinged and torn a bit from use. The walls and corners of the walls were nicked and dented a bit. The glass on the table where the TV sat was cracked; the bar/fridge had a half consumed wine bottle in it. The air conditioner was not working. So we were forced to open the windows at night, which allowed noise in. Honking horns and revving mopeds. The hotel is also located by a main intersection, so we heard many buses and trucks, and it is also located by a university so that brought much noise and activity too. Sunday morning was the quietest. Because the air conditioning was out, we had to keep the windows open. When the windows were closed the noise is really blocked out good, but we roasted when the windows were closed. The windows do a good job of blocking out the noise though. The doors to the hotel close heavily. In the morning when all are coming in and out of the rooms for whatever, you hear the doors slam. Was difficult to sleep with the noise from the doors. Can be overlooked. The Bathroom…small shower. There was some mould spots on the shower here and there, not a big deal though. The toilet seat was wiggly loose. The bathroom door open right on to the bed. There is no space at all in this hotel room. Me and my wife were stepping over each other as we tried to get around the room. There was a light out in the bathroom, no biggie but it just adds to the agg. There was dust and lint build up on the bathroom lamps, the smell was a bit musty. There was also a stain on the bathroom ceiling where the toilet water tank sits. There was no tissue paper provided for blowing nose or wiping stuff, would have been nice to have. But if that is not important then all is well. Not a bad place just not my cup a tea. Also posted pics of our view from our room, facing the street. The star-rating on the sign indicates 2 star. One night on a Saturday, after a nice romantic walk and dinner, we come back to the hotel to find trash bags piled up on the front on both sides of the walk in. This made us feel bad about our choice in hotel. On the positive side, the hotel staff were great, helpful and full of good info about the city. Definitely a family runs the place. If you want a budget, this is what you’ll get. The outside hallway was nice. The main attractions are 30 to 45 minute walk – all was a walk in a half for me; €8-€20 taxi ride, depending on traffic. When walking near the termini you pass a few bums and not so great areas, I didn't feel too safe at night walking past the Termini area. Too far out of the way for me. One night going out to dinner, we left a restaurant in Trestevera area at 12:30 midnight, we did not get to the hotel room until 3:30AM because all the taxi drivers were busy, Saturday Summer night issue only I think. We got asked if we wanted to pay 40 euros to get to the hotel by some scammer taxi guy, but we declined. If we stayed in a hotel in central Rome we would have not had to worry about a taxi to the hotel and not be stuck walking 90 percent of the way back to the hotel between 12:30AM and 3:30AM;my wife was ready to beat me up! The hotel is farther out than we expected or desired. Basically near the Termini, which is a bit out for us, maybe not for others. There is a great area of shopping on the Via Nazionale, that makes the walk to the main city area ok. There were some nice cute restaurants around the hotel, but we chose to stay in the city area for fun during our visit, not anywhere near the hotel.
