Walking around the city, we saw beautiful hotels near the river and some nice areas that appealed to us better. Basically you will need to pay €150 and up a night to get comfort and higher standards. Other than that, it is a good budget hotel and you just have to see for yourself. Personally I would not go back there or that area again. Rome is so beautiful and I think to stay in the city area anywhere near the river would be a good option for us next time. Near the river and main city area there some nice places, real Rome feel with small cute streets. Areas I will look to stay next time will be anywhere along the river, Piazza Novana, Camo dei Fiori. Enjoy Rome! It is a beautiful City

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: James2006UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent position within 5 mins walk of the Termini. The hotel occupies part of a shared building, but this is of no consequence. The rooms are of an adequate size with a TV, safe, air-conditioning and are clean. The staff are friendly. The rooms looked as if they needed maintenece. (cracks, broken plugs, cover on air-conditioning unit, phone etc.) Overall: I would return because the hotel was a good price in a good area.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant staff, not so ideal hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff here is quite pleasant and accomodating, yet the hotel is located in an old building with 3 other hotels in a not so great part of town. The main problem we had with our room was that it felt very humid in the room and we could not figure out how to adjust the air conditioner. Also, the shower stall was the smallest one we've encountered in Italy and our clean towels were placed in the bidet.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place for the price”
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Gabriella. Our room was small but very clean and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast was good and always served with a smile. The only downside was the hand held shower. It is easy to get around from the Hotel Gabriella as it is near the Termini but avoid the #64 bus to the city centre and the Vatican as it is always very overcrowded. Instead catch the #492 on Via Castro Praetoria.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay On A Budget”
Reviews.Author: FlightAttendant
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here at the beginning of December 2004. The hotel was inexpensive and just a few blocks from Termini Station. The staff was very friendly and the rooms a good size and very clean - which I understand isn't always the case in Rome. We are planning to go back to Rome in February and are planning to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great cost/location combo!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 2-week trip to Europe where we spent time visiting London, Paris and Rome. While in Rome we stayed at the Hotel Gabriella, and I have to say that we were very pleased with the accomodations. We paid approx. $105 a night (before taxes) for the stay, so obviously we weren't expecting a 5 star hotel. The front desk attendants and staff were all very pleasant to work with and the room was very decent and clean. Loved all the marble in the bathroom! It was VERY close to Termini (the main train/metro stop in Rome), and there are lots of restaurants and shops in the general area to visit. Also, there's a vendor shopping area set up every morning just outside of the hotel. Got a few nice deals on some Italian scarves! What do you get @ the Gabriella - great location, somewhat small but very decent room, 13" television, nice and clean bathroom, and free breakfast. What don't you get @ the Gabriella - 5 star accomodations, a great view from your room (we had a view of a busy street). Suggestion - set up your accomodations through Hotels. They gave us the best price on all of our hotels and we had no problems once we arrived there!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Gabriella
HotelInfo.Address: Via Palestro 88, 00185 Rome, Italy
